name: Sion Kesyk
text_appearance: 180cm, athletic build is framed by a rugged, off-white flight jacket and a reinforced tactical harness. He has piercing slate-grey eyes and charcoal-colored hair kept in a practical, wind-swept crop that stays clear of his face during high-intensity maneuvers. His features are marked by faint, silvery scarring along his jawline—a permanent reminder of early mineral exposure from his home world’s particulate-heavy atmosphere.
history:
Overview

Sion Kesyk was born on Mercade (IK-66), a mid-sized terrestrial world on the extreme fringe of the Dawnline Shore within the Ikaros system. While the Karrakin Trade Baronies and Harrison Armoury maneuvered for dominance in the sector, Mercade fell into a jurisdictional black hole, allowing an unscrupulous third-party corporation to exploit the planet's atmosphere. For years, the corporation operated with total impunity, enforcing bonded labour on a population forced to rely on company air filtration just to survive the planet's toxic air. 

His world’s liberation was finally triggered by a specialized scout wing of the Department of Justice and Human Rights (DoJ/HR). These scouts bypassed corporate blockades to document the systematic Pillar violations, providing the evidence needed for Union to dismantle the corporate board and integrate Mercade as a protected Union member-state.

Soon after, Sion enlisted in the DoJ/HR to join the same division that saved his people. Now serving as a Union Scout, his mission is to infiltrate the most remote reaches of space to identify Utopian Pillar violations before they escalate.

NHP Profile: ORION

Born from the chaotic electronic feedback of salvaged corporate sensors and a cascading NHP, ORION is a spontaneous manifestation—a "wild" entity that Sion Kesyk chose to stabilize and shackle himself rather than report for cleansing.

NHP Class: ARGUS Class
Origin: A newly manifested class, ARGUS-class NHPs are paracausal entities with an effectively infinite capacity for parallel sensory processing, derived from a NOAH-class NHP. The name reflects the "all-seeing" hundred-eyed giant of myth, a nod to the NHP’s primary purpose: ensuring that nothing goes unseen. Emerging from the dense data-streams of the Dawnline Shore, this class excels at identifying the "blind spots" that Union’s enemies rely upon.

NHP Name: ORION
Sion named this specific instance ORION, after the Great Hunter of the stars. It serves as a personal anchor for Sion, designed to be a "Hunter of Truth" rather than a mere data-sifter. Because it manifested from Sion's own equipment during a period of deep-space isolation, its subjectivity is intrinsically linked to his own need for a vigilant, stoic partner.

Personality: The Steady Navigator
ORION does not possess the frantic energy of a typical combat AI. Instead, it is characterized by an immense, patient stillness. Sion tailored ORION to be a "second set of eyes" that never blinks and a "second mind" that never tires of the dark.

  • The Anchor: Sion programmed ORION with a personality that is grounded and slightly dry. Because a scout spends months in isolation, ORION is designed to be conversational and "human-adjacent" to prevent Sion from succumbing to madness or the isolation of long-range transit.

  • The Filter: ORION acts as a moral and logical filter. It is capable of independent thought and learning, and Sion has encouraged it to challenge his own biases. If Sion becomes too focused on a single target, ORION is the one to remind him of the bigger picture.

In the field, Sion and Orion operate as a single unit. While Sion uses his expertise to scout and skirmish, ORION handles the "heavy lifting"—sifting through noise, predicting enemy movements, and keeping their mech's signature invisible to enemy sensors.
quirks: Something changed you – you now have persistent and intrusive mental contact with an entity or entities, human or otherwise.

weapon.flavorDescription:
Much like GMS mechs, GMS weapons are reliable galactic standards, made using interchangeable parts and built to withstand almost any conditions. There are three lines currently in production.
The Type-I (T-1) line is defined by powerful, reliable, and conventional-kinetic ranged and melee weapons, including the GMS assault rifle, heavy machine gun, shotgun, pistol, and various light and heavy blades. Reliable galactic standards, the GMS T-1 line is the most widely used mech-scale line of weaponry across the galaxy. Echoing the Everest’s design notes, T-1 weapons are simply designed, with few (if any) moving parts, intended to be used in or adaptable to any environment.

The Type-III (T-3) line is made up of heavy weapons, ordnance, and other exotic, specialized, or massive weapons. A broad classification, the T-3 range includes conventional-kinetic anti-materiel rifles, super-rapid cycling pulse rifles, missile racks, cannons, and drone nexuses – “hive”style launchers that serve as miniature factory, hangar, and deployment systems for portable drones. The classification also includes the fearsome “segment knife”, a system that uses flash-printing to produce disposable edged weapons in a vicinity around the user.

armor.flavorDescription: Light hardsuits are usually made from reactive, cloth-like weaves, with limited plating and few powered components to maximize mobility. Like other hardsuits, they can be sealed against vacuum, and protect against a decent amount of radiation and other harmful particles.

weapons.flavorDescription: Light A/C weapons might be knives, bayonets, punching daggers, and short swords.
Medium signature weapons are assault rifles, shotguns, pack-fed lasers, or disruption guns.

gear.flavorDescription: Small, non-combat drones are a common sight in the field. They’re fairly noisy but can fly about half a mile with good maneuverability before losing signal, relaying audio and visual information as they go.

Discovered on Acrimea IV, a biome cultivar world controlled by Smith-Shimano Corpro (SSC), the sylph is an organic lifeform that can seemingly survive in nearly any environment. Using breeding-analogous methods defined by established bioengineering doctrines, SSC developed the sylph undersuit – sterile, living sylphs grown as envelopes and fitted to their owners. The sylph bonds to its wearer, forming a symbiotic relationship: the sylph is sustained by the host’s waste products, in return protecting the host from a range of hostile environmental factors.
These semi-biological, skin-tight undersuits can be worn for extended periods. They are translucent, semi-liquid, and able to be stored when not in use, conforming to whatever container they are placed in. They clean the host’s body, aid natural healing processes, and eliminate waste. As desired, segments can become opaque, change color, or take on a new texture. Sylph undersuits can cover the host’s head, sealing against vacuum, providing protection against radiation, and filtering air or liquids, even providing the ability to breathe water for a limited time.

A subjectivity-enhancement suite is a set of cybernetic implants allowing users to hack systems without a rig. Users of these suites blend the organic with the synthetic, gaining the ability to extrude implanted universal-plug cables from within their body to make hardline connections with terminals. When plugged in, users can access a comprehensive, fully interactive alternate-reality interface with direct omninet access, making navigating – or hacking – local and networked systems as easy as wishing it so (of course, you must be careful: by opening up your mind to the digital, you may face dangers other, less enhanced people are ignorant of).
